Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Jaldrichl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Serrano a few weeks ago for a conference a few blocks away. While the hotel's neighborhood isn't perfect, it's nice, safe and central to pretty much everything. Market Street, Union Square, Mission Street, trolleys, plenty of shopping and restaurants were within easy walking distance. Staff was friendly and helpful and the on site restaurant had good food and service as well. I'd definitely stay there on a future trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a few extra services made all the difference”
Reviews.Author: LEC_LGC
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a 12 night stay at this hotel for a business trip. It was selceted by a colleague and I will admit it would not have been my first choice. The location is good and I followed the advice of other reviewers and the hotel front desk to avoid the streets that led directly down to Market Street as the area is a little dubious. I noticed other reviewers saying that the hotel service and staff were not friendly. In the 12 days there I did not find this at all. In my dealings with the front desk staff they were always helpful and curtious. If the lobby area was not busy I was usually greeted warmly by the staff on duty. The little extras that I have not found at more expensive hotels in the area were most welcome. I made good use of the free wi-fi and was pleased with the coffee/tea available in the lobby during the morning. As I was there on business, my shcedule did not allow me to take advantage of the hosted wine hour. I'd recomend asking for a room on the east facing side of the hotel on one of the higher floors (rooms 10-16 I think). My room was one of these and on clear days the morning sunshine was very welcome once I had opened the curtains. It was also good to be able to open the room windows as many hotels seem to rely solely on air conditioning. I used the attached bar/restaurant for one breakfast and one evening meal. I thought that there were better options available locally and the food was a little oily for my taste. Overall a pleasant stay and I would consider re-booking in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Well located to explore SF from”
Reviews.Author: charmingdelusion
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco to celebrate my birthday, and was happy to get an excellent rate at The Serrano. The hotel itself was a great place to stay as it was well situated for exploring San Francisco, and had many, many easily accessible transit routes. I was able to take BART in from the airport, and able to take transit to go to the Japanese Tea Garden, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 33 (for an Alcatraz tour), and transit to and from restaurants at night. The Serrano is within easy walking distance to Union Square, and all the shopping and dining that area has to offer. A quick trip down Taylor (be warned, it doesn't take a long walk to get into the heart of the Tenderloin) took us to our favourite brunch place, Dotties on several mornings. All of the staff was friendly and helpful, however I'd like to mention that the concierge named Stephan was amazing. When asked for walking instructions to the shops on Union Street (not Union Square), he suggested a great route along Polk where we were able to avoid marching up and down hills, and able to stop into a number of great shops along the way. When we complimented him on the excellent route the next morning, he told us it was his wife's favourite wandering route as well. Our room was lovely, and had a great number of electrical outlets. This might seem a strange thing to mention, but as someone who travels with an iphone, ipad, chargable camera batteries, and an ereader - it's amazing how many times I'm at a hotel with no where to charge my electronics without unplugging lamps, tv's or mini fridges! Way to go Serrano! :) The Serrano also placed me on a higher floor - which was much appreciated. A lovely view from the 16th floor. This is my 3rd stay at a Kimpton property, the other two were Ink48 in NYC and the Argonaut, also in SF. Of the 3 Kimptons I've stayed at, I'd rate this hotel as my second favourite after ink48. ink48 edges out the Serrano as the staff at ink48 went out of their way to provide me with a fantastic experience for my birthday last year (complimentary sparkling wine and pastries sent to my room, many suggestions of places to go celebrate, front desk recognizing me each time I came past, etc.); it was also my birthday when I stayed at the Serrano, and no special fuss was made for me. I guess this is the difference between a New York hotel, and one just about anywhere else in the world! :) That being said, this certainly is a place I'd stay again the next time I head to San Francisco! The Argonaut is also fantastic, but as it's right on the Wharf, it is a little more difficult to manage as a base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Having a Birthday?”
Reviews.Author: R_V_travel_11
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what problems recent reviewers experienced but on a second trip here this year and also as a regular returning visitor, I do not see any noticeable changes in quality or staff attitude. In fact I booked this trip as a birthday break and received a wonderful gift bag plus sparkling wine and desert in the restaurant downstairs. The Jaspers staff went out of their way to make the visit enjoyable and were extremely courteous. However, I would like to see a wider selection of wines at the evening wine reception, not all visitors are able to enjoy the limited selection on offer. Raid the minibar and free internet are a boon to business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the Tenderloin”
Reviews.Author: chiz147
Reviews.Content: A convenient location for the theater district with all the quality and friendly service you'd expect from a Union Square hotel. Once you step inside the Serrano you'll never know you're in the Tenderloin. But still an easy walk to places like the Great American Music Hall (awesome place to see a show btw). And if you'd like to avoid the street shenanigans it's easy to find a cab. < $10 cab fare to Fisherman's Wharf. Yes, parking is expensive. But this is San Francisco, parking is expensive everywhere. Either take the train in to the city or know that you're going to have to budget for parking. Be sure to check-in in time to enjoy their daily wine reception in the lobby from 5-6pm. Great way to start off the evening. Overall, I recommend the Serrano and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The place has slipped considerably.”
Reviews.Author: DGfromDallas
Reviews.Content: The Serrano was a great boutique hotel a few years ago, but time and neglect from Kimpton have tarnished its reputation. When I first visited a few years ago, the property was immaculate and had great service. The desk and bell/valet staff was great. I don't know what happened in those three years, but Kimpton just seems to have written off the property and the service levels. The most helpful person of all was the doorman/bellman on the second shift. He was sharp, helpful with assistance and directions and overall a great person. The same cannot be said of the desk staff, who seemed overall uninterested in doing anything more than standing behind the desk acting like they were sedated. It took me several calls and I finally had to physically come down to take care of two problems in my room that the desk staff didn't even acknowledge until the valet reminded them to call someone. Sorry, but the Serrano is just not that large or busy enough of a hotel to have such a complete lack of attention to guest needs. The hotel itself needs a refresh, and the room was small, dingy and quite noisy. The room itself was only slightly larger than the bed, and it felt like I was staying in a pop-up trailer most of the time. The hotel is in a dodgy area at the edge of the Tenderloin, so you could not go out at night unless you were in a group. Overall, the experience was definitely not worth the money. The only reason I gave the hotel three stars was due to the great second shift valet. If I had to rate it solely on the desk staff, I would have asked for negative stars.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Check out”
Reviews.Author: schnepper
Reviews.Content: I used to like this hotel, stayed many times. The restaurant went from Asian Fusion to a pub, unimpressed with the food when I stayed in Jan when they first opened, but haven't tried since so can't really comment. The hotel is small, rooms are tight, and parking is expensive- all typical for Union Square. A few of the front desk and bell/ valet staff are great, a few are mediocre. The wine reception was unimpressive (as compared to other Kimptons), very generic wine- go there on work trips and never make it back in time for wine anyway. No coffee maker in either of our rooms, but great coffee in the lobby so it is a good excuse to go down and mingle. I had an issue on this last trip which will switch me to another hotel for my next SFO biz trip. We stayed at the Serrano on April 9th, I had two rooms (one of them a suite) and was given 2 x mini bar vouchers to use during our family stay. The woman checking me out would not let me use both vouchers- she insisted it was 'one voucher per stay'. I explained a few times, that my wife was in one room, I was in another (with kids in each), we had two stays (2 rooms x 3 nights) and I was given both vouchers (one for each room) on check in. She was adamant that I could only use one (despite being giving one for each room on check in). Very annoying. I decided not to argue over $10.00- but it was very frustrating, and totally unnecessary for a return guest to have to deal with check in telling me one thing and check out refusing reason.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: omern
Reviews.Content: Good size room, great shower, helpful staff. very clean and modern looking. The location is right on the edge of a problematic area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Convenient Location, Use EZ Park for $20/day parking”
Reviews.Author: sstayner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3/30 - 4/1. Found an excellent deal of $83/night on priceline. The hotel was rated 3 star on this website. I would bump it up to a 3.5. It is much classier/nicer than the 3 star Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance (5-10 minutes) of Union Square. The hotel staff were courteous, efficient and a pleasure to work with. The room was tastefully decorated. This is a "Boutique" hotel, so the rooms are not like mini apartments in some more modern hotels. However, this added the the ambiance of the San Francisco experience. The parking at this hotel is $40/day. However, if you pre-book on the web at EZ Park on 333 Jones Street, (2 blocks away) you can safely park your car for $20/day including taxes with in-out privileges. The neighborhood surrounding lot looks a little rough, but there is a police station on the corner and I had no problem walking back to the hotel at 9 pm at night. If you are female, might be best to take a friend. There are homeless people, as you see throughout the entire city. They appeared harmless.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again - Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumNZ
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived at the hotel on St Patricks day evening I was't so sure about this hotel due to the bar near reception being noisy and crowded, and I didn't find the front desk staff member at all friendly. Over my 6 night stay, the hotel grew on me and I found it quite homely and a good base. The room - Is compact but nicely decorated and with good natural lighting, and excellent black out curtains which is important for a holiday sleep in. The bedding- A very comfortable bed with good quality sheets and pillows. I had a very good sized king bed. Bathroom - Immaculately clean and I must say the cleaner must have scrubbed and polished everything daily. The toilet looked like brand new each day. Good quality toiletries and lots of pressure in the shower. My rate included breakfast which was a simple juice, toast and coffee which was about enough (just). The hotel is only a matter of minutes walk from Union Square so easy to bring all your bargain purchases from Macys back to the hotel. The hotel allows dogs which is very strange as we don't have this policy in New Zealand. It felt a little strange sharing lifts with dogs,and I did hear the odd bark from rooms here and there. Maybe you need to request both a non smoking, and non dog room in the future :-) I have stayed at several other Kimpton Hotels and always find them to be a good base to stay. I have no hesitation in recommending the Serrano Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect lover's getaway (away from the kids)!”
Reviews.Author: MFarcus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to San Francisco for the week end. We don't take many trips without the kids but this hotel was perfect. The rooms are very clean and elegant. We had a great view of Downtown. The staff were really great. The suggested restaurants which were great and really had the best service. The location is near everything. Although the infamous district "tenderloin" is near, the area is very quiet and we found safe. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Discsam
Reviews.Content: Clean, great location and great rooms. Can't ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jhernan
Reviews.Content: The Serrano Hotel is a small boutique hotel with an attentive & polite staff to help you with your stay in SF. Because we are now retired, we take advantage of their reduced rates when they become available. Check with the hotel's website during the year for that. We paid $120 for each of our three days at the hotel, before taxes & fees, There is a wine hour for guests, from 5 to 6, to either unwind from a day in the City or to get ready for dinner. Coffee & newspapers await you in the a.m. till 10:00a.m. in the lobby. The rooms although small ( we had a 260 ft sq room with a queen size bed) was very comfortable, room 1104, & I'll ask for that room next time, too. Umbrellas are available for your stay in case it rains. The hotel is also close to two of our new favorite restaurants, too : John Grill on Ellis St & Scala's Bistro on Powell. We had a fantastic time during our stay at the Serrano.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down.”
Reviews.Author: Milemark
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Kimpton properties and have stayed at many. They are usually reliable, quasi quirky with a bit of cool thrown in. Unfortunately, this was not the case with the Serrano. The location of the hotel is what I would characterize as seedy and purse clutching. Take a cab and do not wonder outside at night. The lobby and the rooms were shabby (not in a good way). Room was clean and servicable but seemed like the wallpaper and carpet had seen better days and would benefit from a cleaning. I would not suggest to take a walk barefoot. Bed was not comfortable and was rather slanted and off kilter. Not really inviting. Fellow floor dwellers left their dishes and other random items in the hallway (used hairbrush anyone? random sock?) I realize this is not the hotel's fault, but when you see these items in the morning and then again on your return in the evening it makes you wonder if the cleaning staff ever really cleans the rooms or the floors. Mini bar in our room did not work or was not fully stocked. Learned this upon check out when the guy behind us mentioned he had eaten snacks from his. Ours only had drinks- no snacks! Jasper's the hotel bar and restaurant extrodinarily over priced ($14.00 for a simple omlette????). I would encourage Kimpton to cast of this property from their collection as it know has me questioning the reliability of their other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Not living up to advertisement”
Reviews.Author: tony87ooo00
Reviews.Content: I am putting what I wrote my first day 3/21 - then will add for my last day: I had not intended to write anything so early in my stay. I arrived a little over an hour ago. The room is great overall. I took pictures and will post them as well when I have a chance. I did not expect to be on my computer so quickly and trying to prove what the website said about Kimpton's Best Rate Guaranteed. I spent quite awhile at the check-in counter. First, I was astounded when I was told that the $25 food & beverage part of the offer was related to purchasing a room package. Second, the staff member got on the phone pretty quickly at that point to get someone else involved. That person was more like "Charlie" from the old "Charlie's Angels"...only a voice on the phone. He never came in person. Yet, the counter person told me that I should never have gotten the lower rate because I didn't book it at the 3rd party website...the website was bid-based like priceline or hotels.com. Then, he said they would allow me to keep the rate that I had already reserved and they would look into it more. I kept telling the guy this was on their own website. Later, I just got a call in my room telling me that "this one time", they would honor the rate and the $25 promise from the Kimpton website. I had the website up on my laptop & read it to the guy who had told me "it was probably in the fine print". He told me that the unnamed person he talked to has been with the hotel for many years doing reservations and had never heard of the website (venere.com) where I found the rate and the reservations person matched on the phone after verifying it herself. I came here anticipating a very fun and pleasant stay based on other reviews and the website. The management was responding to every review it seemed. That impressed me & I thought that that must mean a very responsive customer-focused place. Right now, I feel like they are still trying to say that I misread the guarantee, it doesn't say what it says, and I have no faith that it will be honored in the future since it was just "this one time". --- Sure, the robe is in the closet, the free wireless is there, and there is supposed to be a wine reception right now which I will go check out. But, feeling like I had to fight for something that is promised, and feeling like they think they did me a "favor" rather than acknowledging that I was informed & cared enough about giving this hotel my business that I actually read up on it.... I don't know... starting off this conference & vacation sourly. ===================================================== Going to go checkout after doing this.I have read reviews posted today by others yesterday...I wish my experience was same. I like the hotel and the wine reception. The towels are great. The housekeeper did more than was needed usually. Even though I would put towels up to keep, they would be changed. The thermostat was always turned off and the room would be cold when I returned at night. No biggie & easily remedied. 14th floor room - not spectacular view if looking for "sites"; but it was a nice view to wake up to. Some street sound is to be expected...nothing that interfered with sleep or anything like that. I thought back to check-in and how that went. The front desk guy acted like he did not know about playing a game to get something free or to make a charity donation if I lost. I had to explain it...then he said "Oh oh yeah". He would only do blackjack and then didn't know where the cards were which were right by his keyboard. When I lost, he didn't know about the SPCA or what the money was for or went to. Frankly, I wonder if he kept it. That is not the way I want to feel about a staff. The weather provided on the TV never worked. The Best Rate Guarantee...the restaurant didn't know what I was talking about. I added a day as I had expected. The key was extended by the front desk. However, when I got back to my room that night, it didn't work. When asking for a map at the concierge, they did not have any to provide. The guy said he would get one to me, and never did. The account summary on the TV worked the second day; but has not worked every other time I have tried including today. I am quite concerned that the rate for the extra day will not be what I was told it would be. I expect there will be issues with the $25 food/bev credit for the guarantee. This has been pretty unsettling when I think about these things and just want it all to be smooth. The location, cleanliness, noise, and all that were just fine. It is just a disappointing thing that I spent nearly double what some other colleagues have spent at nearby hotels and they felt things were much easier and smoother. So... really think about what you NEED to feel comfortable and good. If peace of mind with where you stay and no struggles are it...this is NOT going to be the hotel for you. I hate that this is what I had to write.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: swj1051
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in kimpton hotels in San Francisco, Portland and Seattle and have yet to be disappointed. This was our first stay at the Serrano. The rooms are cozy and the staff and atmosphere is friendly and engaging. As with other Kimpton's there is a nightly wine reception. The lobby was a little on the cool side with the door opening many times during the very rainy windy day. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahA76
Reviews.Content: My finace' and I loved this hotel! We just got engaged and he had called ahead to see if there was anything they could do to help us celebrate. They upgraded us to an executive suite. When we walked in, they had chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne waiting for us, along with a congratulations card. The room was beautiful. They had an enormous bathroom with a jetted tub and a very comfortable King sized bed. Everyone was so friendly and helpful there. It is in a great location near Union Square . Every evening they have a complementary wine hour in the lobby. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a city break”
Reviews.Author: rob1london
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights at the Serrano and couldn't really fault the hotel. The staff were always helpful, especially the front desk staff. It's location was ideal - only 5 minutes to the main cable car and Union Square. Yes, if you turn right out of the hotel you do enter a poorer district which could be interesting after dark but you don't really need to. We didn't eat in the hotel but the free wine reception every night between 5 and 6 was a nice touch. Overall an ideal hotel, relatively inexpensive and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful girls week-end!”
Reviews.Author: Idefourny
Reviews.Content: It was m'y second stay in à Kimpton, and couldn't wait to experience the San Francisco version compared to NY, which I loved (ink48). I, and my friends, we're not disappointed! Rooms on the small side, but that was expected. Being an "in touch' guest was very rewarding, from great rate, to amazing perks such as wine, cozy socks, a full bag of Ghirardelli chocolates and personalized notes! Oh, and the "raid the minibar" voucher! And of course the wine reception, and I won at the check-in Black Jack! Great staff and great location. Did not experience Jasper's restaurant which was too load to our taste. Would definitely go back to Serrano, and so will my friends.

Reviews.Title: “great little boutique hotel - small with lots of character and service”
Reviews.Author: Breezy_in_Virginia
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on a Friday night after a flight from the east coast. We were very warmly greated, the bellhop immediately looking at our luggage tags so he could call us by name. And, John continued to call us by name our entire stay. Check in was fast. The lobby was very eclectic, lots of character and charm. The staff quickly got us to our room and delivered our luggage. Rooms are small. This is a big expensive city and a boutique hotel, so we knew what we were getting. But, who needs a huge room when you are on vacation and only planning to sleep and bathe there. Regardless of size, it was very comfortable and accomodating. Only possible challenge for anyone larger than average is the rest room. The commode is literally just about next to the tall bathtub, not leaving much room to navigate the facility. Hotel service continued to be great with restaurant suggestions, maps, etc. They were very helping hailing cabs. Coffee in the morning in the lobby and newspapers were a nice addition. Car service back to the airport for our return was prompt and professional. Overall, a great little place. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like boutique hotels, this is a winner”
Reviews.Author: EPB65
Reviews.Content: We pulled up on a rainy night after a long flight and were greeted by a friendly staff that ushered us inside while attending to our luggage. Service throughout our stay was consistent and attentive. The lobby is charming, warm and friendly where organic coffee is served every morning and wine with snacks every evening. The location is convenient to many area attractions, shopping, and great restaurants. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and tastefully decorated. We would absolutely stay at this hotel again next time we visit San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “"Great for Business Travel"”
Reviews.Author: scm1133
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Serrano Hotel and I would return for another stay. It was a functional hotel and it was comfortable for the 1 night. Pros: GREAT shower, nice amenities, comfortable bed, wine happy hour, and free wifi for members - all great perks that contributed to a good customer experience. Cons: I called in advance to request a feather free room. When I arrived, I confirmed it and the front desk representative read me the notation on my account and confirmed that my room would be feather-free. It was 100% not feather-free. I would have preferred an honest 'I don't know" or "I don't think so - let me check" rather than getting up there and getting all itchy and sneezy because of the down. They sent up someone to switch out the pillows and the blanket, but still detracted from the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: damien d
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Serrano hotel this past weekend and I must say the service and accomodation was great. Really nice and helpful when it came to suggestions for dinner. Another great benefit was it's central location to the BART station. Lobby experience was a blast with the free wine during happy hour and the room had a sweet view of the city. Highly recommend if you are looking for a great weekend with a central location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “People make a difference”
Reviews.Author: Loi Y
Reviews.Content: My experience was a great one with the Serrano. We had a group of 12 people that stayed at the hotel. Hotels in San Francisco are naturally small, but the service was fantastic huge and more than made up for the small rooms. All the staff members were friendly and genuinely happy to be there. The director of guest relations also surprised our group with a welcome package waiting in our rooms. If you want the best grilled cheese sandwich with pork belly check out Jasper's which is the restaurant in the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends because it is centrally located to shopping, is pet friendly, and most of all a very friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Kimpton hotel with a few challenges”
Reviews.Author: eeg1977ok
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels. The service and staff of the Hotel Serrano is no exception. However, there were a few issues with my recent stay. First was the noise, I was on the 16th floor and it would still was unbelievably loud. The garbage gets picked up at 4:00 AM, every morning. Ask me how I know this. Second, the bed was lumpy and uncomfortable and third, and maybe it was only in my room, the mini-bar fridge was iced over and was working super hard and loud. Housekeeping was great and kept the room very clean. The location was great, only a few blocks to Union Square. A garage was next door so parking was super convenient. Be sure to play a hand of blackjack upon check-in so you can win a prize!

Reviews.Title: “Love this property!”
Reviews.Author: Lance T
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for years every time I come to SF. I love that the doorman have stayed pretty much the same crew since the opening. This trip I was with a buddy so we stayed in a standard double bedded room. When I am with the wife I spring for the upgrade to a suite and it is well worth it. They recently upgraded the restaurant. I loved the old space but the new theme has great cocktails and really god food. The pork belly grilled cheese is off the charts. Negroni on tap as well. For a city hotel the service is really good. It has the feel of a boutique property and that makes you forget you are in the heart of San Francisco. The Assistant GM was really nice as well. We met her at the cocktail hour. Can't remember her name but she was great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpionxylo
Reviews.Content: My first time at Serrano and I am very impressed with the location. Let it be business or tourism, staying at this hotel will put you bang in the center of downtown. Very close to Powell BART station (0.5 miles) and about 0.4 miles to get a ride on the world famous cable car. Westfield mall is 0.5 miles too. The intersection of Powell and Market Street where all the shopping is, is only 0.5 miles. Close to market street means it is a bit far to the touristy locations of Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, Pier 39, Embarcadero road etc. All the destinations are around 2 miles from the hotel. Regarding food, never had in Serrano's restaurant but there are plenty of restaurants catering to all variety of people around Serrano. You will get almost all the cuisines around Serrano. That is not a problem at all. Regarding the staff, they are OK. They could do a better job, be more friendly. That doesn't mean they have done a bad job, they are there for whatever you want, but they could be a bit more friendly. The rooms are medium sized with flat screen televisions. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is adequate. If you have 3 to 4 big suitcases, it might be a bit cramped but majority of the rooms in San Francisco are of this size. One thing I was really disappointed about this place is Wifi. It is complimentary but sucks big time. It is slow by US standards and is very inconsistent, by far the worst internet experience I have had in all the hotels I stayed. Terrible, without this problem I would have rated the hotel 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: pdxmike
Reviews.Content: Kimpton does it right every time in my experience. The Seranno was no exception. Employees are friendly and knowledgable, room was small, clean and in fine condition despite not being recently remodeled. Lobby was cozy, ornate and served as a great space for the requisite 5pm happy hour. Concierce recommended dinner at Le Colonial, a French/Vietnamese restraurant on an alleywat a few blocks from the hotel. It turned out to be one of the most memorable meals I've had in a long time. I'm planning on staying there again on my next trip to SF!

Reviews.Title: “I was duped”
Reviews.Author: Kempka
Reviews.Content: Lovely potential however didn't deliver. Toilet clogs, sink clogs and small rooms.. Staff was amazing however the hotel itself doesn't live up to the expectation in a Kimpton Hote.l

Reviews.Title: “A very late review (visited in 2011)”
Reviews.Author: William_Helgason
Reviews.Content: I liked the look of this hotel, and the theme, e.g. a games hotel, unfortunately when we visited the building was under serious structural renovation. The lobby was nice and shabby, something you do not see in America very often. The room was big and strange. The room was actually two rooms, one with a big TV hidden in furniture, and I could swear it was a CRT. Location is very central. I am on the sidelines on this one - based on the renovations going on at the time, it might just be a great hotel today - who knows?

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience I've Had :)”
Reviews.Author: MYLO020710
Reviews.Content: We got of the plain at San Francisco after a long flight from London. We were all tired, after a long flight. As our taxi pulled up outside the Hotel, we were greeted by a member of staff at the door who did all the luggage handling for us. (I hate hauling suitcases around). At the desk we went to check in when the staff realised my father was disabled. He darted off to speak to another gentleman, after which we were informed we were checking into a suite! Free of charge upgrade. The suite was fabulous, however my favourite bit was the bathroom! We had a walk in shower with about 8 shower heads, it also had a steam function which was nice. But there was a TV you could watch in the shower and a little seat. It was nice watching TV in a steam room! The hotel is also situated within walking distance of Union Square where there are a lot of shops. However getting around SF is easy with all the buses, cable cars and trams! I would highly recommend this hotel and I will stay here on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Tohono
Reviews.Content: My room was really nice and located on the higher floors, as per my wish. Upon check-in, I said the "password" that was posted on the hotel's Facebook page and a complimentary bottle of Pinot Grigio was delivered to my room. I attended the wine hour every evening and met many other hotel guests. Another great stay in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for a walking tour of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: bhardyfam
Reviews.Content: Very good location with easy access to Union Square, the Financial District or Nob Hill. San Francisco is a great walking city and you could walk virtually anywhere downtown from this hotel. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is pretty safe with a lot of young people out on the street--although walking too far to the south or west means a less welcoming area. The restaurant and bar on premises works well for those who want to stay nearby for dinner. The wine hour is always a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Updated”
Reviews.Author: WoodWorksAshland_OR
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Serrano twice now while attending a conference at the Moscone Center, and will definitely be staying there in the future. It's an older building with smallish rooms. But they have been completely updated and are comfortable, clean, and are a pleasant refuge from the bustle of the city. The restaurant downstairs is great and convenient for breakfast and dinner. And the location, though close enough to the Tenderloin to make late-night excursions a little iffy, is not very far from Union Square and other central SF attractions, as well as BART and other transit options.

Reviews.Title: “a cute find near downtown SF”
Reviews.Author: pj1290
Reviews.Content: Very lovely lobby with fresh flowers, rooms were small but clean and modern. The morning coffee and free newspapers were a delight. Bed was super comfortable. The neighborhood isn't great at night (like most of SF), but it was a quick and easy walk to Union Square. Just walk with another person!

Reviews.Title: “Ah, a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hapgator
Reviews.Content: High marks for the Serrano. Wonderful room and good location downtown -- to walk to Ferrry Building (where Slanted Roof is a must-go-to restaurant -- book well in advance). Staff was first rate and glad to be of help. My wife's wallet somehow fell out on our way to the car to drive to the airport and a hotel staffer promptly called us on the cell so we could turn around and avert disaster (her not having ID to get on the plane, or getting the wallet and getting to the airport too late to catch our flight). All in all, this is a place that pays attention to the little details that add up to make a big difference in enjoying a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price is right, but would not choose again”
Reviews.Author: palitigate
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for two nights for a convention in San Fran. The event was at the mosconi convention center was was .7 miles away. Since it rained the whole time I was in town, I didn't walk but it seemed further than .7 miles and was a good $6-8 cab ride away. Not a great neighborhood as the hotel has 3 massage parlors, a liquor store and smoke shop within view of the hotel. Unless that is what you are looking for! Felt seedy to me and the hotel was dark and very small. I was supposedly upgraded to a larger room for $12 more a night and my room was very tiny. Can't imagine the non upgraded room. It had everything you need, which all Kimptons do, but most are much nicer. I had meetings at the Marriott marquis which blew away this hotel. Not even same ballpark and I was sorry I didn't pay more (double) to stay there. Especially since that hotel was across the street from the convention center. Overall, if you just need a cheap place to sleep, this is fine. If you are used to a Marriott or hyatt, you won't like this place.

Reviews.Title: “A little tired, but great staff”
Reviews.Author: chefsteve
Reviews.Content: Not a bad walk to the convention center. Sure the area to the west of the hotel is a little suspect, but going towards Union Square or the convention center is fine. I had a room near the elevator and am told these are a little bigger. It was clean and actually relatively large for an older hotel. Beds were comfortable, slept well. Advantages to staying here--like all Kimpton hotels I have stayed at the desk staff went way out of their way to be helpful and the convention rates are better than most. Would stay again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room with poor ergonomics”
Reviews.Author: puddleduckUk
Reviews.Content: I was rather disappointed with the Serrano. However, since I hate to complain, I'll mention the positive points first. The location is very good, only a couple of blocks from Union Square and a 5 minute walk to the nearest tram/light rail stop. The reception staff are professional and helpful. The lobby is attractive, and features free tea/coffee and free wine for one hour each evening. If you join the hotel's rewards programme, you get free easy-to-connect wifi throughout the hotel. We also got complementary continental breakfast vouchers, valid at the adjoining restaurant - and the food was pretty good. However, my room was tiny, barely larger than the queen-sized bed. There was no desk, which is a serious omission for your average business traveller, and very little floor space to spread luggage around. My colleague, who paid the same rate, did get a desk and more space - so presumably you can demand something bigger if you don't mind making a fuss. Another annoying feature was the glowing light switches. Presumably they are lit to help you find them in the dark, but in my opinion they are far too bright. Given the tiny dimensions of the room, it was like being surrounded by a row of candles all night. Another couple of things: the television was at the side of the bed, making it difficult to view from the bed; and there was a surprisingly large gap between the toilet and the toilet roll dispenser (fortunately I'm quite tall!). Probably both a result of the inconvenient room size, and whilst neither of these made me seriously grumpy, they're not features I expect to find in a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: StaciaNYC
Reviews.Content: The customer service is 5 stars at this comfortable Kimpton property. There is a free wine reception in the lobby, very helpful staff, free coffee and tea in the mornings, and if you are an In-Touch Member free wi-fi. The rooms themselves are very well decorated and very comfortable. The location however... not good. The property sits on the cusp of the really bad part of San Francisco (The Tenderloin), and feels unsafe as soon as dusk hits. It is close enough to the really nice area, just make sure if you're alone you take a cab at night to and from. I did walk every morning at 9AM to my San Francisco office on California Street & Montgomery, and it was a nice, easy walk with a lot of other business people lining the streets. This is a REALLY nice hotel so yes, I would come back, but I'd just stay very alert when going out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwitteman
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Everyone so friendly and welcoming. Great little wine hour each evening. Rooms were fine, I've had smaller at other Kimptons. Was able to check in at 10:00 a.m. and we were upgraded to a King when I told them we were In Touch members. Also asked for a high floor and was given a choice of rooms on the 16th floor. Lobby area is warm and inviting. Area is just a little sketchy, but that's SF. Only walk a block and you're in the midst of tourists/families/great museums/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eaw88
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here! The only thing I would have to comment on is that the room and bathroom were a little small. Other than that, everything was great. Jasper's Restaurant was excellent, level of customer service was top-notch, and thought it was a nice touch to provide drivers with hybrid vehicles 25% off the price of parking. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: KatVonC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Serrano hotel and got a deal on Priceline, it was the best deal for the location and the amenities it offered. The room was small and there wasn't much of a view but it was clean and for the price it more than sufficed. It was wonderful to walk everywhere! We didn't have to get a cab at all, walked all over town from Union Square, to the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium, it was a great hotel, we would love to stay again! We parked our car directly across the street and had no problems although the Serrano has valet parking for the same price as the parking garage. Lastly, the bar attached to the Serrano, Jasper's was fabulous, great beer on tap and a nice, young vibe, we would have liked to spend more time here. Overall, a great trip and we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the mildew”
Reviews.Author: ACsTravels
Reviews.Content: Pluses *large room *comfortable bed *quiet with windows closed * free wireless internet and $10 free minibar with Kimpton In-Touch membership *aveda products * restaurant downstairs Minuses *extensive (wall to wall) mildew in the bathroom above the towels * not the safest area at night but not the worst either (the Hilton is across the street but so are various motels and massage parlors) *customer service varies from excellent to indifferent depending on the individual *overpriced room service: inflated prices (compared to the restaurant's menu downstairs) + $3 service fee + mandatory 20% gratuity Note: I noticed the bad mildew problem in the bathroom in the morning and notified the Front Desk Clerk at checkout. The clerk's response was "I'll let housekeeping know. How was your stay other than the mildew?" which felt like an unsatisfactory response to me. When I returned that evening to pick up my stored luggage, I mentioned the issue to the front desk staff again and the Manager immediately compensated me for the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and San Fran Rate”
Reviews.Author: Toad143
Reviews.Content: Check in was very efficient. Staff was fantastic. It is a historic property with charm but like most older buildings it has its quirks. The beds were very comfortable, I had an awesome city view (1606), LCD flat screen TV, comp internet. The bathroom was tight. Furniture was nice. Fitness room is down in the basement but was fine. Coffee and hot cocoa in the morning, wine and cocktails during happy hour in the lobby. Walking distance to great restaurants. Had to wait for valet to get the car, give them 30mins notice to be safe. All in all in was a pleasurable experience. Safe travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cobaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in a double with my 16yo son. The hotel is a smaller, boutique hotel - with a gorgeous lobby - quirky and welcoming. As I've come to expect from a Kimpton, the service is always wonderful - welcoming and professional. Location was convenient to union square and transport. The room and bathroom were a little small, but a super rate and great service means I rate this hotel as exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnighter in The City”
Reviews.Author: BowlderMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because my wife's company Christmas party was nearby, and we didn't want to deal with transportation home afterwards. It was great. The front desk staff was super-friendly (without appearing insincere), the room was great, and we had a nice view out the window. It was a short stay, but everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: julios6666
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! While the room were quite small, they were also comfortable and it was incredibly quiet for a boutique hotel. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Many nice touches”
Reviews.Author: hollyberry57
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights for business and had a very enjoyable experience. I'm comparing this with the Hotel Adagio, located about 2 blocks away, which I stayed at earlier this year and rated Very Good. The building is older and my corner room (a single, with a full-size bed) was smallish. The large windows opened and were new; all glass was double paned with a vacuum between, which made the room very quiet in this not-very-quiet part of town. Service was excellent. There was a problem with the heat in my first room and they switched me right away. Nice touches with the Kimptons are the complimentary wine hour, very good coffee in the lobby from 5:00 AM, free Internet for signing up for their reward program (wireless seemed slow, but there's an Ethernet cable in the drawer under the mini-bar), and the leopard-print bathrobes. The immediate neighborhood is not the greatest but you are steps away from Union Square and, well, that's just San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: cambridge00
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite, which allowed us a curtained-off room for our baby. Room was a great size, with a large bathroom. The hotel had a free crib, which was great. The staff was extremely nice, and the location very good -- just a 5-minute walk from Union Square, and about 15 to the modern art museum and Chinatown. The wine reception every evening was very nice too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon destination!”
Reviews.Author: mecanoe
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite here for our honeymoon and couldn't have been more pleased. We had excellent friendly service. The rooms were a good size and we found the location to be handy for the small amount of site seeing we did.

Reviews.Title: “especially nice lobby, everything else fine but not very exciting”
Reviews.Author: fuzzyhb
Reviews.Content: stayed here on business, so i cannot comment on value for money because i did not shop around. gorgeous lobby. nice breakfast in the restaurant. nice staff. standard hotel room, all clean modern, full working order. good location for downtown, plenty of restaurants etc nearby

Reviews.Title: “Bright and comfy accomodation near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: pks1957
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to have passed up the conference hotel booking to look around the neighborhood for a place with more character. Loved what I found. I took Tripadvisor advice to book a higher floor deluxe room (very little extra cost) and stayed in a quiet (even on Halloween weekend!) corner room with views of the SF hills. While the wine reception was lovely, the goldfish snacks were a downgrade from previous reviews. Nevertheless, it was great to gather with friends during the happy hour in the lobby. Local friends who met me there wanted to book a room! One little note: Access to computers and printing boarding passes were not complementary. Would have been a nice touch if they were with little extra expense to the hotel. That said, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Great Room - Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinsFinest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Serrano one night for business. Had a great corner room with views of Nob Hill and Union Square. Loved the whimsical design of the room. Went down for the complimentary wine hour, where in addition to wine, was served goldfish crackers and a delicious tapanade. Asked the front desk for driving directions to a restaurant in North Beach, and the associate was happy to print them for me. Received a $10 "Raid the Minibar" voucher upon check-in by being a member of Kimpton In-Touch. It was appreciated and utilized. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, stylish and on the right side of quirky”
Reviews.Author: madebymoonlight
Reviews.Content: Superb, richly appointed and generally lovely hotel within easy walking distance of Powell or Union Square. Pet-friendly and so are the owners- nothing like nuzzling up to a huge St Bernard as a welcome to SF. Staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome with free wine and random lectures/activities in the early evenings. Superb restaurant/bar on the ground floor that's rapidly becoming a neighbourhood destination. Rooms might seem a little small to those used to corporate monsters. But they're well appointed and have a good mix of modern convenience and period features. (Being a Brit, though,wouldn't mind a kettle.) The 3* for location is because while the hotel itself is in a safe neighbourhood, one block over it gets quite iffy (it's quite obvious which way you shouldn't go). Ask door staff for directions or a cab anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ladydrake
Reviews.Content: We are fans of the Kimpton chain and stay at their hotels frequently. This hotel was a fabulous location and the staff was super polite and helpful. Our room was not as nicely appointed as others in their portfolio and was small..... and not a great view. The room is probably in need in a bit of an update but was clean and had ample light. The afternoon wine event is fun and featured some nice wines.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanWarwick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over the weekend. We were greeted at the taxi by the door staff and helped in with our luggage, the check in was good and then another guy took us and our luggage to our room. The staff were very helpful when we were trying to make decisions about where to eat, what tours to do and how to get there. The room was nice, nothing out of the ordinary, mini bar, safe, loads of hanging space and coat hangers, TV etc... The bathroom was quite small and there was no where to dry wet towels apart from on the rack above the toilet....I didn't like that. The shower was over the bath, which isn't a problem normally, but it was annoying that you couldn't get in at the bottom on the bath as it was too sloped, so you have to get in the tap end and get straight in the water...again..not a massive issue...when the shower stopped I could hear water under the bath but not drained away, like there was a layer between the floor of the bath and the bottom? weird. Breakfast offered is tea, coffee and hot chocolate and there is a wine reception every evening 5-7pm. This was the 2nd time we had stayed at A kimpton hotel and we received a $10 mini bar voucher to use because of this. Location was excellent, 2 mins from union square, cabel car stop, subway lines..etc All in all it was good.

Reviews.Title: “newest downtown SF Kimpton is refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Mks323
Reviews.Content: It was the only SF Kimpton I hadn't heard of, and the only one with rooms available. I was skeptical but the manager sent a nice email promising a room with a view - promise was kept - and the lobby was a jewel box. The room and tiny bath were very clean and minus some of the overdecoration that the chain favors.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny bathrooms with no counter space and poor lighting”
Reviews.Author: littlegoldenone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for a conference at Moscone. Paid $219/night and I would never stay here again. First time at a Kimpton property and maybe my last. Billed as a "luxury boutique"... Yeah right. Older building. Room dated, old carpet..very dirty..socks I wore got filthy..wallpaper very scuffed and dirty, mold on bathroom ceiling. Definitely could have used more lighting in room. No light in closet. Bed ok. Bathroom was the worst I have seen in a $200/nite room. European hostels have more convenience. There was a small tub with a small alley beside it to get out of tub...single sink and NO COUNTER SPACE. Small ledge above sink filled with their toiletries and single ledge high on wall above toilet. Had to use hot flat iron by placing on closed toilet seat ledge and this led to an accident. I stepped on the cord as it was all over the floor in front of sink and tripped on it. Flat iron fell through my fingers burning them and then it stopped working as cord got yanked. UGH! so frustrating and very dangerous. Lighting in bathroom also not good. So if you want a bathroom for doing hair and makeup this is not the hotel for you. I asked the hotel front desk staff if all the rooms had such lack of counter space in BR and the woman was kinda like 'what do you expect..it is an old hotel'. I guess I expect better if you are going to bill yourself as "luxury boutique". Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JJMTravelers
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute so I was worried what we'd find and was pleased with what we found. Hotel and rooms were quaint and well kept. No view and teeny bathroom but the location, cleanliness, and service staff make this a recommended stay. Only significant gaps are no coffee maker in the room (although free in the lobby) and a horrible hair dryer (bring your own).

Reviews.Title: “A Quirky Hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: Imation
Reviews.Content: We originally were reccomended to stay at the Hotel Monaco (another Kimpoton Hotel) but it was booked out. This turned out to be on the next corner from the Seranno. If I could, I would suggest staying at the Monaco as a preference. It has a more interesting lobby and restaurant / bar downstairs. That being said, the Seranno was a good hotel with some interesting quirks such as the afternoon drinks (done at all Kimpton hotels). The street around the corner was a little rough and once discovered we did avoid it. The rooms are a little on the smaller side but good amenities and extra touches (such as the yoga bag and exercise classes on the TV). A good hotel and worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loveholidays201129
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel just off union square, the rooms were lovely and clean, bed very comfy. Free wine from 5pm-6pm nice touch, and great to meet other guests. Will stay here again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient locale with old-world style”
Reviews.Author: CarlosFR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Spanish-styled boutique for a few days in May at a discounted price. It’s conveniently downtown, diagonally located from the Hilton. Walking distance to the Powell St BART station and cable car turntable near Hallidie Plaza. Simple & inexpensive to take the BART from SFO airport to the Powell station. Then just walk 2-blocks west on Eddy and another 2-blocks north on Taylor until you see the hotel on the NW-corner of O’Farrell & Taylor. An easy walk to downtown locations, like the theater district around Union Square (3-blocks away), Chinatown, or you can hop on the cable cars to reach touristy stuff down on the wharf. Grab a day- or multi-day pass if using the cable cars more than 2 times a day. Large open, lobby with old-world styling. Coffee & tea provided all day in the lobby. Nicely appointed rooms and bathrooms, but not much of a view with our window overlooking an opposite building. You can let your inner-beast loose with the Serrano’s leopard-print bathrobes! Renovation work was taking place on the outside of the hotel, but it was hardly noticed since it was limited to day-time hours when away touring/seeing the city & hopefully the work is done by now!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice one night stay with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: McKeever-MD
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying for business one night in San Francisco prior to heading home. when I booked at the Serrano I had to find a rate with in per diem as some travelers have to do on occasion. when I came across the Serrano (boutique type hotel) I wasn't exactly sure what to expect but I figured for one night I would give it a shot since i could stay with in budget. When I got to the hotel we arrived a little late for the inTouch wine and social hour but the front desk staff (Kathryn) took care of me by providing a voucher for a drink at Jasper's which is part of the hotel. She also did her best to rearrange my room reservation to a king bed versus the 2 double bed room I had as my reservation. When I got to the room I was very pleased with the changes she made for me. The room was the right size for a one night stay and provided me with the ability to knock out some work I needed to do in the morning prior to heading home. The location is close to Union Square for shopping and short walk to the Powell St. BART station (as well as the Powell St. Trolley) for travel to the airport. I will definitely look into staying at the Serrano the next time I am in town and with access to rental cars with in a block, try to stay at the hotel for my entire stay the next time I am in the area for business.

Reviews.Title: “Conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tre_Landrum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business conference so got a conference rate. For the price we paid it was a very good deal. The room was on the small side, but not near as small as in some other major cities. The beds were very comfortable. Ice machines were only on about 4 of the 17 floors, but there was one just one floor down from our room so it worked out very well for us. I like a lot of ice, and if we would have been 2-3 floors away from the ice machine it may have been a problem for me. The area right around the hotel seems very safe, but I would not go more than about one block to the east (toward 6th and Market street). Even going one block south you notice the neighborhood getting a little more sketchy. If you go all the way to Market, and especially go down 6th street after dark it quickly begins to feel quite unsafe after dark. Going even 1-2 blocks East (5th or even better 4th street) is much nicer. Going East or North you will find some very nice shops and places to eat. (and I must admit a very good donut shop one block South of the hotel). Boudin sourdough bakery has a shop about 2 blocks East and must not be missed while in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: angie_the_nurse
Reviews.Content: Hotel decor tired and dated, staff very helpful tho and made all the difference especially the doorman and Angelique in Jaspers, location a little far out from the wharf for our liking but an enjoyable stay in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: nicole_hobley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the begining of our honeymoon. We found it be good value for money for the price we paid. It was clean, tidy and the staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are a little small, but fine for the amount of time we spent there. The wine hour that they hosted each evening was brilaliant. A good way to relax after a tiring day! The location was great, union square was a short walk away. However when you go out the hotel turn left as it seems to get abit rough in the other direction. We ate at Jaspers a couple of times - good burgers and very friendly bar staff. We would definately look at booking another Kimpton hotel when we return to the US.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful "Wicked" experience!”
Reviews.Author: AirlinesOfWorld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Serrano from September 14 - 17, 2011. My room was not ready upon arrival, and was upgraded to the "Wicked" suite, themed to the musical. The room could use a little update, as furniture is dated, but a great experience. Staff was very friendly. Room climate control worked very well. Wished the hotel had better security, as it is not in the best of neighborhoods, and anyone can use the elevators. It is a convenient walk to the Cable Car line, BART, and Muni. While the cost is high, this is the norm in San Francisco. A pleasant surprise was the $10 gift card given to me to use in the honor bar located in my room. This was a plus, as a pop was $3. The theming in the room was great, and loved it. The afternoon wine social hour is a nice touch. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Cris2007
Reviews.Content: I give this rating for many reasons: 1) Convenient location: a couple of blocks to Union Square and BART station, 5 minute walk to SFMOMA, about 15 minute walk to the Ferry Terminal, Chinatown, etc., 2) Cleanliness of the rooms, 3) Affordability , 4) Friendly service, and 5) A fun bar and restaurant. Indeed the rooms are pretty standard but I couldn't ask for a better experience during my 3 night stay there about 2 weeks ago. It started with our checking in. I casually mentioned to my traveling companion that we missed the wine reception and without missing a beat, the staff attending to us asked whether we preferred red or white. Surprised, we said, Chardonnay to which he replied, "we'll send a bottle to your room." Our reservation was a deluxe double but we got a room that did not have a decent view of the city. I called the front desk to see if it was possible at all to move to a room that would have a nicer view. After about 5 minutes, the staff called to apologize for the time he was taking to find us a room with a better view. I told him that I appreciated his efforts and will understand if he didn't find one. Several minutes later, he called to inform us that we've been upgraded to a junior suite on the top floor and offered to send a porter to help us with our luggage! Moments into our new room, the knock on our door brought a bottle of properly chilled chardonnay! Hooray to Serrano Hotel staff for exceeding our expectations!!!! Moral of the story: Always be nice and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: gilbertos303631
Reviews.Content: I "ve stayed 5 nights at this hotel ,during a business meeting in San Francisco,sept 2011.it is an average hotel in a good location near Union square,room is spaciousand clean.Breakfest just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard stay...”
Reviews.Author: ninama3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a busy convention weekend and it was one of the only hotels near the square that had rooms open. THE GOOD: Extremely convenient location - walk to Union Square easily. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. Connected to a bar/restaurant with decent food. The room was clean, beds were comfy. Fairly quiet. THE AVERAGE: Pretty standard hotel for being in the city. Definitely one of the more affordable hotels in the area. The elevators take FOREVER. At the end of the day, would stay again - mostly for the convenience and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: jsilinsky
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 170.00 per night for a conference. Clean and quiet. On par with a Marriott. House keepers did a great job. Front desk staff was helpful. Bathrooms were a little on the small side, but they have aveda bath products so maybe that balances out.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton standards as good as ever.”
Reviews.Author: kelrock
Reviews.Content: Good service, great location and clean, comfortable beds. Housekeeping staff very cheerful and friendly, same goes for concierge staff. Slept well, and was well rested to head out into the city every day. Be careful about wandering too far west into the Tenderloin if you're not used to stepping over people and the strong scent of urine, but union square to the east provides easy tourist access. The Serrano is a regular rest stop for us in San Francisco. Recommended without reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy, Cute Room”
Reviews.Author: pinkie1837
Reviews.Content: I really loved staying at this hotel. I stayed 5 nights, mostly for a work conference, with an extra day of fun thrown in. The building is really pretty if you take a step back & look up at it & I had amazing views of the city from my room, which was a nice, quiet corner room, & I thought the decor was charming. The bed was really cozy, great linens & pillows! The bathroom was a little on the small side, but adequate. Staff was very accommodating & friendly. The hotel is a quick 5 minute walk to all the hustle & bustle of Union Square & all it's transportation & restaurant options. I also liked that this hotel was pet friendly. I didn't have my dog with me on this trip, but I am a dog lover, so it was cute to see the little pet welcome station & occasionally see a dog walk in or out of the hotel. Jasper's, the restaurant downstairs, had great food & service as well with generous portions & tasty cocktails. Parking is a little pricey ($40 plus city taxes/night), so if you're driving keep that in mind! There is a parking structure directly across the street for (slightly) cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure at first...”
Reviews.Author: Leprechauna
Reviews.Content: Initially, having a room right off the elevator...a little put off, but it was a priceline deal. Had an issue with a bachelorette party in the room behind our headboard, Called front desk, handled within less than 15 minutes. The staff was helpful with every encounter. The complementary coffee every am was delicious, and the wine tasting every evening was a very nice touch. The rooms were small, but very realistic in a downtown venue. The beds were very comfortable. Great launchpad for the places that we wanted to go. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: dwilkin999
Reviews.Content: This hotel from the time we walked in assured us that we had made the right decision. The staff, especially Kathryn Chen, was excellent. We had a trip advisor rate of $143 and I had made a mistake by not booking the next day since our flight was leaving at midnight. So accommodate us we got an in-house rate on a Saturday for $279, but we received a luxury suite for both nights honoring the $143 as well. Then, the wine receptions and taking care of recommendations for dinner were also great. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ohdudepp
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Depending on the room it could be a little small but definitely has character and charm.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice stay, and price was right.”
Reviews.Author: goodweather_11
Reviews.Content: Serrano was neat and tidy. it has interesting decorations. the location is very nice and central. we booked our room through hotwire and got a very good deal. make sure you sign up for the free membership to get free wifi in the room. free wine taste every evening too!

Reviews.Title: “The stuff is really incompetent”
Reviews.Author: ichuk
Reviews.Content: The stuff is incompetent, could not find reservation. After we had payed for the room again they found the reservation ) Location is rather poor, although in couple blocks there is a union square, in the evening a lot of homeless people are around the hotel. Breakfast is average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Puddinator
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convenient to the Powell BART station and Union Square. There are a couple of nice diners like the Pinecrest around the corner. Room and bathroom were clean and tidy. The hotel is elegant with an old world charm. Nice coffee bar in the lobby in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel, central location.”
Reviews.Author: Scrutineer
Reviews.Content: As a family party of five we stayed in two rooms here for our first 4 nights of a three week trip to California and Las Vegas. The hotel has a good, central location, the room was quite small but comfortable with nice fittings. A continental breakfast was included in our room rate, and it was just what we needed to start the day, fresh fruit and croissants/bagels/toast with coffee. The free wine welcoming hour every afternoon is a good idea. Hotel is in walking distance of Union Square where all the citytour buses stop. Kimpton seem to have quite a few hotels in San Francisco, each with their own individual themed restaurants. We would recommend the Grand Cafe just up the street from the Serrano, also the fish restaurant next to their hotel near Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, and perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: pdoudar
Reviews.Content: We visit our son in San Francisco every other month, andvwe usually stay at a different hotel. We found this hotel my chance. we loved the art deco entry, the hotel lobby, hallways and rooms were spotless and comfortable. If there, ask to play a hand of blackjack for a bottle of wine or free beakfast

Reviews.Title: “"Every hotel tells a story."”
Reviews.Author: beagle47
Reviews.Content: The title is assigned by Kimpton, chain owner of this property and, sure enough, the property lives-up to its claim. The lobby is nicely appointed and service from check-in throughout is personable and excellent. Parking is a big pain but, hey, it is SF so expect it too be difficult and expensive wherever you go. The room standard room is long and lean but well-appointed. The restroom is right next to the bedroom which is convenient but offers little to the imagination if the fan is not turned-on. Super quiet room, which is impressive as is the view looking-up at Non Hill where we usually stay. The wine hour is hosted by the hotel in its lobby; cool to hob-nob but prepare to stand as seating is spare. The wine poured is typically bleh but Jasper's next door has a good bar selection though that costs. Overall this is a nice place to stay if you want to see how the other half lives as this is the Tenderloin District which, as those in-the-know know is not for the easily shocked or offended. Ghod theatre district and union square accesibilty but expect to pass a few interesting scenes along the way. Hey, you really want to go home without a uniquely SF story? If so stay somewhere else. But if you want a crazy SF story this is your pick.

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Friendly Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SusannahDanna
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful boutique hotel close to shopping, restaurants, buses, cable cars, streetcars & BART. It is nostalgically old with great character. Friendly staff who sincerely wanted us to enjoy our stay. We really liked the wine tasting hour in the lobby - met couples from Canada, Australia, Madison & Chicago; one night we had quite a party going when it ended at 6pm, so the server brought over a couple of opened wine bottles for us to carry on. We ate one breakfast in connected Jasper's Restaurant, food was good but a little spendy compared to neighborhood breakfast restaurants - but handy if you don't want to leave the hotel to eat. After reading about the bed bug outbreak in April, we brought along a spray that we used on the carpet surrounding the bed, but didn't see even one bug. Overall = A+, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: justine t
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Serrano for 4 nights in August with our 11 month old. The hotel was amazing from start to finish! When we arrived we were greeted with a room upgrade which was so nice since it gave us much more space for our son to crawl around and for us to put all of his stuff! The room was amazing, the bed was soooo comfy! We felt like we could have spent our whole vacation just hanging out in the room and we would've been happy! Also when we arrived there was a playpen set up for my son and a highchair with a beautiful teddybear holding a welcome card addressed to our son! What a nice suprise! Definately made us feel special! The staff were always pleasant and ready to help. I had been in touch with the manager JP to ask a few questions before we got there, and he always had prompt responses and was more than helpful! I was a little worried about the area and being there with a baby, but we had no problems. As long as you don't go to the streets behind the hotel, you are in safe territory! All in all the trip was amazing, and a lot of that was due to the Serrano! Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Fun Times!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaggy923
Reviews.Content: Had friends in from out of town. I live in a tiny SF Studio apartment & we wanted a "girls weekend" so I suggested we stay at Serrano as it's close enough to my apartment (in case I needed something) yet far enough for me to feel like i was on vacation too. It's near Union Square. The hotel lobby is really nice & comfy & I LOVED the wine hour-FREE WINE FOR HOTEL GUESTS!!!! The Hotel staff was extremely nice & helpful - no attitude & very accomodating. We were lucky enough to also be able to eat & drink at their new restaurant, Jaspers that recently opened. What a treat - all kinds of mixed special drinks -the Bay Bridge Buck was my FAVORITE!!!! The food was "gastropub" and very good. I especially enjoyed the Ham & Cheese fritters & the Sausage bites...I love appetizers for dinner. Anyhoo, the price was right, the staff were pretty awesome & yes, I would recommend to any friends or family coming into town. Also it's a pet friendly hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: MBG05061964
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean and beds are very comfortable. Interesting mix of guests. Nice touch with the wine and snacks each evening at 5:00pm. (And coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the mornings.) Relaxed atmosphere and well located. Easy walk to Union square and the BART station.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Delana J
Reviews.Content: We loved this place--cool art deco lobby and well-appointed rooms. Excellent service from doorman, valet, garage attendant, front desk personnel, housekeeping, and a genuine "welcoming" atmosphere. Blackjack at check-in is fun, the hosted wine in afternoon & coffee/tea bar in a.m. are nice. Proximity to Union Square is great---all in all a really good value, particularly in S.F. This staff aims to please--if you aren't completely satisfied, they want to know & will attempt to remedy any concerns to the best of their ability. They have a fitness room & sauna for all guests. We have stayed in much more expensive hotels but have not had better service! Can't wait to refer friends & stay again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back”
Reviews.Author: Blase2320
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely gorgeous! Not only that but the staff is impeccable and they greated us by name during our stay. Everyone, specially the manager went above and beyond to make our stay perfect. The decor is exquisite, loved the wine reception. I would suggest that if you are traveling to San Francisco you should definitely stay here. If there were more than five stars i would give them to the Serrano Hotel. Thanks for the great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, comfortable stay with GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: juliettt
Reviews.Content: Over our 3-day stay, our family received nothing but great service. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. It was our first time to SF and the concierge gladly spent time with us, making sure we felt welcome. Lobby is beautiful and the Goldfish crackers were also delicious. This hotel is HIGHLY recommended! It was such a short walk to Union Square and other city attractions. Just don't walk into the "shady" little district at night near the premises...

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem...good customer service”
Reviews.Author: INTLTRVLDUDE
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Serrano hotel for a night. It is located adjacent to Union Square and the Cable Car main stop. You can get there from airport by taxi or BART (with some walking). The staff at check-in was very courteious and helpful. They responded to my request and questions with proper manner and professionalism. The room was a bit small but still bigger than the hotel rooms in Europe and Japan. The mini bar has quite a collection. If you join their InTouch loyality program (free), you will get $10 towards the mini ba plus free internet. Overall, a nice little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Wisco-traveler82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Kimpton hotels before in Chicago, Boston & San Diego and have never been disappointed; this recent stay in San Francisco was as delightful as I expected from the Kimpton brand. The location was ideal, not far from the BART station on Powell (best way to get downtown from the airport). The rooms were small but that's expected in most hotels downtown San Fran. The staff was super friendly and let's be honest: the free wine tasting from 5-6 in the evening is icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meg2383
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Serrano for 7 nights in August 2011. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The lobby is elegant and nice. The rooms are very small but functional. Comfortable beds and clean but small bathrooms. The location is good as it is very close to union square. Although beware of the bad neighbourhood on the right of the hotel. The highlight of our stay of the hosted wine reception every evening. It is not a luxurious hotel but it is a good solid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond expectation!”
Reviews.Author: Billlake
Reviews.Content: The Serrano Hotel is a hidden gem. It is the level of service which set this hotel apart. My family checked inat 11:00PM. Everyone was tired and a little grumpy. The front desk staff was great. the next morning we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant. The food was very good and again, the service was great. The consierge was knowlegable and helpful. His recommedations were a great fit for my family. Several hours after checkout, I discovered that I had left a gold ring in my room. This was an important family heirloom. I call back to the front desk and spoke with JP. He talked with house keeping, who had already found the the ring and then sent the ring back to me.

Reviews.Title: “great service offsets tight quarters”
Reviews.Author: davew49
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was exceptional. Many of them greeted me by name during entire 4 days. Wine reception was wonderful and loved the unique lobby. Rooms and bathroom are a bit small but liveable. All in all would stay again simply because my family and I were made to feel so welcome!
